title: Cargo: Target may not be installed notes should include which rust version it regards

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

body:
### Problem

When issuing commands on the type: `Cargo +1.52.0 build --target thumbv7em-none-eabihf --release`

the errors can state:
```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note: the `thumbv7em-none-eabihf` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error
```

If these commands are then issued as part of build scripts or other workflows, the command itself can sometimes be quite nested. and attempting to fix the problem with: `rustup target add thumbv7em-none-eabihf`
would not always solve the issue, since the correct command would be `rustup +1.52.0 target add thumbv7em-none-eabihf`


### Proposed Solution

This could be solved by making the error slightly more verbose by including what was written behind the Cargo command in some way

example: 
```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note +1.52.0: the `thumbv7em-none-eabihf` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error
```
or
```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note +nightly: the `thumbv7em-none-eabihf` target may not be installed
error: aborting due to previous error
```

or if no version override command was given: 

```
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `core`
  |
  = note: the `thumbv7em-none-eabihf` target may not be installed
error: aborting due to previous error
```


### Notes

The format of the output text is open for discussion, since its important it doesn't break anything, as well as add unnecessary complexity, if its not needed
